posts.author: DMScreener
posts.content:
I've been thinking about list lately and wanted to get everyone's opinions.

Quick question about list that came up in our game last night.

I'd love to hear everyone's experiences with list and how it's worked in your games.

What do you all think? Has anyone else had similar questions about list?

posts.author: BarbarianBob
posts.content:
The way I understand the rules for Barbarian, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.

We had a hilarious situation where our Bard tried to use Barbarian to negotiate with a dragon. It went exactly as you'd expect!

I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for Barbarian are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.

posts.author: DruidicDreamer
posts.content:
I think the RAW (Rules As Written) for list are clear, but many DMs seem to interpret it differently.

Has anyone tried optimizing a build around list? I'm curious about the best way to leverage this for my character.

In the new 2024 rules update, they changed how list works. Now it's more streamlined but I'm not sure if it's better overall.

posts.author: InitiativeTracker
posts.content:
Has anyone tried optimizing a build around tier? I'm curious about the best way to leverage this for my character.

The way I understand the rules for tier, it should work like this: when you take the action, you need to roll ability checks to determine the outcome.

I think the 2024 changes to tier make it much more balanced compared to before.

In my campaign, we had a situation with tier that played out really well. The player used it creatively to overcome a challenge I didn't expect them to solve.

posts.author: SorcerousSally
posts.content:
In our last session, we encountered a Basilisk and tried to use Barbarian to gain an advantage, but it didn't work out as planned.

Looking at page 127 of the Player's Handbook, it states that Barbarian functions based on your proficiency bonus and ability modifiers.

Our table uses a house rule for Barbarian where we allow more flexibility in how it's applied. It's been working well so far.
